info.description: This is the description of the GeoNetwork OpenAPI. Use this API to manage your catalog.
info.title: GeoNetwork 4.4.5 OpenAPI Documentation

externalDocs.description: Learn how to access the catalog using the GeoNetwork REST API.

tags.description: Proxy for Elasticsearch catalog search operations
tags.name: search

get.description: This service if a dataset has only 1 download format for a CRS returns the file, otherwise returns a feed with downloads for the dataset.

200.description: Get a data file related to dataset

get.summary: Get a data file related to dataset

get.description: Check in the settings which protocol identify ATOM feeds in your catalogue.Only applies to ISO19139 records.
This returns a map with all Less variables.

post.description: Saves custom style variables.
post.summary: Saves custom style variables.
Import a XSLT formatter (usually a zip named 'schema-formatter.zip')

delete.description: Formatters are used to render records in various format (HTML, PDF, ...). When a record is rendered a cache is populated for better performance. By default the cache is an H2 database with files on the filesystems (See <dataDirectory>/resources/htmlcache/formatter-cache folder).

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only Administrator can access it.

post.summary: Update formatter file

get.description:
The catalog contains one or more groups. By default, there is 3 reserved groups (Internet, Intranet, Guest) and a sample group.
This service returns all catalog groups when not authenticated or when current is user is an administrator. The list can contains or not reserved groups depending on the parameters.
When authenticated, return user groups optionally filtered on a specific user profile.

parameters.description: Including Internet, Intranet, Guest groups or not
parameters.name: withReservedGroup

put.description: Return the identifier of the group created.

400.description: Group with that id or name already exist.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only UserAdmins can access it.

delete.description: Remove a group by first removing sharing settings, link to users and finally reindex all affected records.

parameters.description: Force removal even if records are assigned to that group.
parameters.name: force

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only UserAdmins can access it.

get.description: Return the requested group details.

200.description: Group information for the group id supplied.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only UserAdmins can access it.

200.description: List of users in that group.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only UserAdmins can access it.

get.description: If last-modified header is present it is used to check if the logo has been modified since the header date. If it hasn't been modified returns an empty 304 Not Modified response. If modified returns the image. If the group has no logo then returns a transparent 1x1 px PNG image.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only UserAdmins can access it.

404.description: A property with that value already exist.

get.summary: Check if a harvester name or host already exist

204.description: Harvester records transfered to new source.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only UserAdmins can access it.

post.summary: Assign harvester records to a new source

get.summary: List translations for database description table
List database translations (used to overrides client application translations).

put.summary: Add or update all database translations.

delete.description: Delete custom translations stored in the database.

parameters.description: Untranslated key for which all translations will be deleted.
parameters.name: key

put.description: Database translations can be used to customize labels in the UI for different languages.

parameters.description: Untranslated key for which translations are provided.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: Set to `true` to erase all existing translations for that key
parameters.name: replace

requestBody.description: An object where keys are valid 3-letter language codes (e.g. `eng` or `fre`) and values are custom translations for the corresponding language.

put.summary: Add or update database translations for a key.

get.description: Identifier templates are used to create record UUIDs havind a particular structure. The template will be used when user creates a new record. The template identifier to use is defined in the administration > settings.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only Editor can access it.
Operation not allowed. Only Editor can access it.
Operation not allowed. Only Editor can access it.
Operation not allowed. Only Editor can access it.

get.description: ISO languages provides a list of all languages (eg. used for autocompletion in metadata editor).
Languages for the application having translations in the database. All tables with 'Desc' suffix contains translation for some domain objects like groups, tags, ...
Languages available in this version of the application. Those that you can add using PUT operation and which have SQL script to initialize the language.
get.summary: Get languages available in the application

delete.description: Delete all translations from all *Desc tables in the database. Warning: This will also remove all translations you may have done to those objects (eg. custom groups).

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only Administrator can access it.

put.description: Add all default translations from all *Desc tables in the database. This operation will only add translations for a default catalog installation. Defaults can be customized in SQL scripts located in WEB-INF/classes/setup/sql/data/*.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only Administrator can access it.

404.description: Resource not found. eg. No SQL file available for that langugae.

get.description:
Logos are used for the catalog, the groups logos, and harvester icons. Logos are stored in the data directory in /resources/images/harvesting.
Records are attached to a source. A source can be the local catalog or a harvester node. When a source is created, its logo is located in the images/logos folder with the source UUID as filename. For some sources the logo can be automatically retrieved (eg. when harvesting GeoNetwork catalogs). For others, the logo is usually manually defined when configuring the harvester.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only UserAdmins can access it.

post.summary: Add a logo

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only UserAdmins can access it.
Operation not allowed. Only UserAdmins can access it.

get.description: Mapservers are used by the catalog to publish record attachments (eg. ZIP file with shape) or record associated resources (eg. database table, file on the local network) in a remote mapserver like GeoServer or MapServer. The catalog communicate with the mapserver using GeoServer REST API.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only Editors can access it.

put.description: Return the id of the newly created mapserver.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only Reviewvers can access it.

get.description: Return the list of mapservices. mapservices are used to identify secured map services.

If not authenticated, return status 204 (NO_CONTENT), else return basic user information. This operation is usually used to know if current user is authenticated or not.It returns also info about groups and profiles.

Return the list of operations. Operations are used to define authorization per group. Extending the list of default operations (ie. view, dynamic, download, editing, notify, featured) might be feasible but is experimental.
Featured is not really used anymore (was used in past version for home page highlights).
More info

403.description: Operation not allowed. User needs to be able to view the resource.

get.description: When processing, the report is stored in memory and allows to retrieve progress repport during processing. Usually, process reports are returned by the synchronous processing operation.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only authenticated user can access it.

post.description:
Service to apply replacements to one or more records. To define a replacement, send the following parameters: * mdsection-139815551372=metadata * mdfield-1398155513728=id.contact.individualName * replaceValue-1398155513728=Juan * searchValue-1398155513728=Jose
Batch editing can also be used for similar works.

parameters.description: Record UUIDs. If null current selection is used.
parameters.name: uuids

parameters.description: Test only (ie. metadata are not saved). Return the report only.
parameters.name: isTesting

parameters.description: 'record' to apply vacuum.xsl, 'element' to remove empty elements. Empty to not affect empty elements.
parameters.name: vacuumMode

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only Editors can access it.

post.summary: Search and replace values in one or more ISO19139 records

get.description: Preview result of a process applied to metadata records with an XSL transformation declared in the metadata schema (See the process folder). Parameters sent to the service are forwarded to XSL process. Append mode has 2 limitations. First, it only support a set of records in the same schema. Secondly, it does not propagate URL parameters. This mode is mainly used to create custom reports based on metadata records content.If process name ends with '.csv', the XSL process output a text document which is returned. When errors occur during processing, the processing report is returned in JSON format.

parameters.description: Return differences with diff, diffhtml or patch
parameters.name: diffType

parameters.description: Record UUIDs. If null current selection is used.
parameters.name: uuids

parameters.description: Indicates the start position in a sorted list of matches that the client wants to use as the beginning of a page result.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: Indicates the number of hits per page.
parameters.name: hitsPerPage

parameters.description: A search key for the title.
parameters.name: title

parameters.description: A search facet in the Lucene index. Use the GeoNetwork GUI search to generate the suitable filter values. Example: standard/dcat-ap&createDateYear/2018&sourceCatalog/6d93613e-2b76-4e26-94af-4b4c420a1758 (filter by creation year and source catalog).
parameters.name: facet.q

parameters.description: Lucene sortBy criteria. Relevant values: relevance, title, changeDate.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Use the Lucene FuzzyQuery. Values range from 0.0 to 1.0 and defaults to 0.8.
parameters.name: similarity

200.description: Return the catalog content as RDF.

303.description: Redirect the client to the first in-sequence page resource. This happens when the paging parameters (from, hitsPerPage) are not included in the request.

get.summary: Get catalog content as RDF. This endpoint supports the same Lucene query parameters as for the GUI search.

get.description:
A rendering of the geometry as a png. If no background is specified the image will be transparent. In getMap the envelope of the geometry is calculated then it is expanded by a factor.  That factor is the size of the map.  This allows the map to be slightly bigger than the geometry allowing some context to be shown. This parameter allows different factors to be chosen per scale level.
Proportion is the proportion of the world that the geometry covers (bounds of WGS84)/(bounds of geometry in WGS84)

Named backgrounds allow the background parameter to be a simple key and the complete URL will be looked up from this list of named backgrounds

A rendering of the geometry as a png. If no background is specified the image will be transparent. In getMap the envelope of the geometry is calculated then it is expanded by a factor.  That factor is the size of the map.  This allows the map to be slightly bigger than the geometry allowing some context to be shown. This parameter allows different factors to be chosen per scale level.
Proportion is the proportion of the world that the geometry covers (bounds of WGS84)/(bounds of geometry in WGS84)

Named backgrounds allow the background parameter to be a simple key and the complete URL will be looked up from this list of named backgrounds

parameters.description: (optional) the background map projection. If not passed uses the region/getmap/mapproj setting. If the setting is not set defaults to EPSG:4326
parameters.name: mapsrs

parameters.description: (optional) width of the image that is created. Only one of width and height are permitted
parameters.name: width

parameters.description: (optional) height of the image that is created. Only one of width and height are permitted
parameters.name: height

parameters.description: (optional) URL for loading a background image for regions or a key that references the namedBackgrounds (configured in config-spring-geonetwork.xml). A WMS GetMap request is the typical example. The URL must be parameterized with the following parameters: minx, maxx, miny, maxy, width, height
parameters.name: background

get.description:
A rendering of the geometry as a png. If no background is specified the image will be transparent. In getMap the envelope of the geometry is calculated then it is expanded by a factor.  That factor is the size of the map.  This allows the map to be slightly bigger than the geometry allowing some context to be shown. This parameter allows different factors to be chosen per scale level.
Proportion is the proportion of the world that the geometry covers (bounds of WGS84)/(bounds of geometry in WGS84)

Named backgrounds allow the background parameter to be a simple key and the complete URL will be looked up from this list of named backgrounds

put.description:
User rating of metadata. If the metadata was harvested using the 'GeoNetwork' protocol and the system setting localrating/enable is false (the default), the user's rating is shared between GN nodes in this harvesting network. If the metadata was not harvested or if localrating/enable is true then 'local rating' is applied, counting only rating from users of this node.
When a remote rating is applied, the local rating is not updated. It will be updated on the next harvest run (FIXME ?).

put.description:
Privileges are assigned by group. User needs to be able to edit a record to set sharing settings. For reserved group (ie. Internet, Intranet & Guest), user MUST be reviewer of one group. For other group, if Only set privileges to user's groups is set in catalog configuration user MUST be a member of the group.
Clear first allows to unset all operations first before setting the new ones.Clear option does not remove reserved groups operation if user is not an administrator, a reviewer or the owner of the record.
More info

get.description:
Scan one or more records for element matching the XPath provided and save them as directory entries (ie. subtemplate).

Only records that the current user can edit are analyzed.

Examples:
For ISO19115-3 records, use .//cit:CI_Responsibility and compute identifier based on email with .//cit:electronicMailAddress/*/text() to create a contact directory.

parameters.description: Record UUIDs. If null current selection is used.
parameters.name: uuids

parameters.description: XPath of the elements to extract as entry.
parameters.name: xpath

parameters.description: XPath of the element identifier. If not defined a random UUID is generated and analysis will not check for duplicates.
parameters.name: identifierXpath

get.summary: Preview directory entries extracted from records

put.description:
Scan one or more records for element matching the XPath provided and save them as directory entries (ie. subtemplate).

Only records that the current user can edit are analyzed.

Examples:
For ISO19115-3 records, use .//cit:CI_Responsibility and compute identifier based on email with .//cit:electronicMailAddress/*/text() to create a contact directory.

parameters.description: Record UUIDs. If null current selection is used.
parameters.name: uuids

parameters.description: XPath of the elements to extract as entry.
parameters.name: xpath

parameters.description: XPath of the element identifier. If not defined a random UUID is generated and analysis will not check for duplicates.
parameters.name: identifierXpath

post.description: Directory entry (AKA subtemplates) are XML fragments that can be inserted in metadata records. Use this service to import geographic extent entries from an ESRI Shapefile format.

parameters.description: Attribute to use for UUID. If none, random UUID are generated.
parameters.name: uuidAttribute

parameters.description: Pattern to build UUID from. Default is '{{uuid}}'.
parameters.name: uuidPattern

parameters.description: Attribute to use for extent description. If none, no extent description defined. TODO: Add per language desc ?
parameters.name: descriptionAttribute

parameters.description: Create only bounding box for each spatial objects.
parameters.name: onlyBoundingBox

parameters.description: The group the record is attached to.
parameters.name: group

file.description: The ZIP file to upload containing the Shapefile.

403.description: Operation not allowed. Only Reviewvers can access it.

post.summary: Import spatial directory entries

get.description:
Scan one or more records for element matching the XPath provided and then check if this element is available in the directory. If Found, the element from the directory update the element in the record and optionally text or attribute value properties are preserved using propertiesToCopy. Elements can be lost if not existing in the directory entry (eg. from an gex:Extent directory containing only description and bounding polygon, the update can remove temporal element).

The identifier XPath is used to find a match. An optional filtercan be added to restrict search to a subset of the directory. If no identifier XPaths is provided, the UUID is based on the content of the snippet (hash). It is recommended to use an identifier for better matching (eg. ISO19139 contact with different roles will not match on the automatic UUID mode).

parameters.description: Record UUIDs. If null current selection is used.
parameters.name: uuids

parameters.description: XPath of the elements to extract as entry.
parameters.name: xpath

parameters.description: XPath of the element identifier. If not defined a random UUID is generated and analysis will not check for duplicates.
parameters.name: identifierXpath

parameters.description: List of XPath of properties to copy from record to matching entry. Only support text or attribute eg. ./gmd:role/*/@codeListValue
parameters.name: propertiesToCopy

get.summary: Preview updated matching entries in records

put.description:
Scan one or more records for element matching the XPath provided and then check if this element is available in the directory. If Found, the element from the directory update the element in the record and optionally text or attribute value properties are preserved using propertiesToCopy. Elements can be lost if not existing in the directory entry (eg. from an gex:Extent directory containing only description and bounding polygon, the update can remove temporal element).

The identifier XPath is used to find a match. An optional filtercan be added to restrict search to a subset of the directory. If no identifier XPaths is provided, the UUID is based on the content of the snippet (hash). It is recommended to use an identifier for better matching (eg. ISO19139 contact with different roles will not match on the automatic UUID mode).

parameters.description: Record UUIDs. If null current selection is used.
parameters.name: uuids

parameters.description: XPath of the elements to extract as entry.
parameters.name: xpath

parameters.description: XPath of the element identifier. If not defined a random UUID is generated and analysis will not check for duplicates.
parameters.name: identifierXpath

parameters.description: List of XPath of properties to copy from record to matching entry. Only support text or attribute eg. ./gmd:role/*/@codeListValue
parameters.name: propertiesToCopy

post.description: Supported thesaurus are RDF/XML files using SKOS specification, OWL file describing NamedIndividual elements or SDMX file describing Codelist element. For RDF, extension must be .rdf or .xml, for OWL, .owl and for SDMX, .sdmx.

post.description: CSV file MUST contains columns at least for concept id and label. For multilingual thesaurus, consider using columns like label, label_fre, label_ita with languages parameter set to [en, fr, it]. Default language value is used if translations are empty. The thesaurus filename will be the filename of the CSV file (with .rdf extension). It is recommended to set the thesaurus title and namespace URL even if default values will be used based on the filename. Thesaurus dates are set to the date of import.

parameters.description: Type of thesaurus, usually one of the ISO thesaurus type codelist value. Default is theme.
parameters.name: dir

parameters.description: Column name for concept id. Default is id.
parameters.name: conceptIdColumn

parameters.description: Column name for concept label. Default is label.
parameters.name: conceptLabelColumn

parameters.description: Column name for concept description. Default is description.
parameters.name: conceptDescriptionColumn

parameters.description: Column name for broader concept id. Default is broader.
parameters.name: conceptBroaderIdColumn

parameters.description: Column name for narrower concept id. Default is narrower.
parameters.name: conceptNarrowerIdColumn

parameters.description: Column name for related concept id. Default is related.
parameters.name: conceptRelatedIdColumn

parameters.description: Separator used when multiple broader/narrower/related ids are in the same column. Default is '|'.
parameters.name: conceptLinkSeparator

parameters.description: Import CSV file as thesaurus if true (detault) or return it in  SKOS format.

file.description: If set, do a file upload.

201.description: Thesaurus converted and imported in SKOS format.
